text:
Sonia sits beside him, anxious.  
Her heart pounds in her chest.  
Sonia: “What’s the matter?”  

He looks pale, struggling to speak.  
Raskolnikov: “Nothing, Sonia, don’t be frightened…”  
Raskolnikov: “Why have I come to torture you?”  

Sonia watches him, distressed.  
Sonia: “Oh, how you are suffering!”  
Raskolnikov: “It’s all nonsense… Listen, Sonia.”  

He smiles weakly, then shifts.  
Raskolnikov: “I’ll tell you who killed Lizaveta.”  
Sonia: “You really meant it yesterday?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov struggles with his guilt and the impact of his actions on Sonia, revealing his inner turmoil and the need for confession.
